summary: This NBC News article reports on a meeting between federal prosecutors, FBI officials, and Jeffrey Epstein's accusers following a court hearing after Epstein's death. The officials reassured victims that the investigation into Epstein's potential enablers remains ongoing. The article also summarizes the charges against Epstein, his death, and the emotional victim statements from the hearing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of children who died by suicide while awaiting trial.

persons.name: Sarah Fitzpatrick
persons.context: Co-author of the NBC News article reporting on the meeting between Epstein's accusers and federal officials.

persons.name: Tom Winter
persons.context: Co-author of the NBC News article reporting on the meeting between Epstein's accusers and federal officials.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Met with Epstein's accusers and their attorneys, thanked them for their bravery, and emphasized the ongoing investigation into Epstein's potential enablers.

persons.name: William Sweeney
persons.role: Assistant Director in charge of the FBI's New York Field Office
persons.context: Attended the meeting with Epstein's accusers, thanked them for their bravery, and emphasized the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Oversaw the Epstein case and scheduled the court hearing where victims gave statements.

connections.description: Berman's office brought sex trafficking charges against Epstein.
Sweeney, as FBI assistant director, was involved in the ongoing investigation into Epstein and his potential enablers.
Both met with Epstein's accusers to reassure them and discuss the ongoing investigation.
Judge Berman was overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Court hearing for victim impact statements
events.description: A court hearing was held where 23 of Epstein's accusers gave statements directly or through their attorneys, expressing anger and sadness over the lack of justice.

events.title: Meeting between accusers, prosecutors, and FBI
events.description: Following the court hearing, some of Epstein's accusers and their attorneys met with U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and FBI Assistant Director William Sweeney, who thanked them for their bravery and emphasized the ongoing investigation into Epstein's enablers.

events.title: Epstein arrested and charged
events.description: Epstein was charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of children upon landing at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey after a flight from Paris.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while awaiting trial in a Manhattan jail, according to the New York City Medical Examiner's Office.

locations: Southern District of New York (federal jurisdiction)
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors and FBI officials met with Jeffrey Epstein's accusers after a court hearing to reassure them the investigation into his potential enablers is ongoing.
23 victims of Jeffrey Epstein gave statements directly or through attorneys at a court hearing, expressing anger and sadness over the lack of justice following his death.
Epstein was charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of children on July 6, 2019, upon arrival at Teterboro Airport from Paris.
Epstein died by suicide on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial, leading prosecutors to move to end the case against him personally.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly stated the investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment, including a conspiracy count, remains ongoing despite Epstein's death.
